parts.text: {"word":"ho","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"interjection","definition":"(注意を引くため、または喜びや驚きを表す) おーい、やあ、ほら","english_definition":"(used to attract attention or express joy or surprise) hey, hello, look","examples":[{"sentence":"Ho there, mate! What brings you here?","translation":"おーい、そこの相棒！何しに来たんだ？"},{"sentence":"Ho! What a surprise to see you here.","translation":"ほお！ここであなたに会うとは驚きだ。"}],"collocations":["Ho ho ho (サンタクロースの笑い声)"],"synonyms":["hey","hello","yo","look"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"(庭仕事用の) 鍬","english_definition":"a gardening tool with a long handle and a flat blade, used for weeding, cultivating, and moving soil.","examples":[{"sentence":"She used a hoe to remove the weeds from the garden.","translation":"彼女は鍬を使って庭の雑草を取り除いた。"},{"sentence":"The farmer hoed the rows of vegetables.","translation":"農夫は野菜の列を鍬で耕した。"}],"collocations":["garden hoe","draw hoe","grub hoe"],"synonyms":["weeder","cultivator"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(鍬で) 耕す、雑草を取り除く","english_definition":"to use a hoe to cultivate or weed.","examples":[{"sentence":"He hoed the garden every morning.","translation":"彼は毎朝庭を鍬で耕した。"},{"sentence":"We need to hoe the rows of corn.","translation":"トウモロコシの列を鍬で耕す必要がある。"}],"collocations":["hoe a garden","hoe weeds"],"synonyms":["cultivate","weed"],"antonyms":[]}],"etymology":{"value":"語源は複数あり、間投詞は古英語の「ho」に由来し、注意を引くための叫び声。鍬は古フランス語の「houe」に由来し、ゲルマン祖語の *hauwanan 「打つ、切る」に関連する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/hoʊ/","syllables":"ho"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"hoes","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["hoe","hoes"],"past_simple":"hoed","past_participle":"hoed","present_participle":"hoeing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**ho**」は、文脈によって意味が大きく異なる単語です。間投詞としては、注意を引いたり、喜びや驚きを表したりする際に使われます。庭仕事の道具である「鍬」としては、名詞と動詞の両方の用法があります。スラングとしての用法もありますが、ここでは割愛します。","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ He hoed the garden with a rake.","correct":"✓ He hoed the garden with a hoe.","note":"鍬（hoe）と熊手（rake）は異なる道具です。"},{},{"incorrect":"✗ Ho! I didn't know you were coming.","correct":"✓ Oh! I didn't know you were coming.","note":"驚きを表す場合は、"Oh!"の方が一般的です。"Ho!"は、よりフォーマルな印象を与えることがあります。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":[],"phrasal_verbs":[],"priority":"★☆☆"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2 (鍬としての用法)、C1 (間投詞としての用法)","frequency_google_ngram":"低頻度 (Low frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**ho**」は、いくつかの異なる意味を持つ単語です。間投詞としては、「おーい」や「やあ」のように、人に呼びかけるときに使われます。また、庭仕事で使う「鍬（くわ）」という意味もあります。文脈によって意味が異なるため、注意が必要です。スラングとしての用法もありますが、ここでは説明を省略します。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"**Ho**, come over here and help me!","translation":"おーい、こっちに来て手伝ってくれ！","type":"interjection","meaning_category":"注意を引く"},{"sentence":"She used a **hoe** to till the soil.","translation":"彼女は鍬を使って土を耕した。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"鍬"},{"sentence":"He **hoed** the weeds in the vegetable garden.","translation":"彼は菜園の雑草を鍬で取り除いた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"鍬で耕す"}]}
